g.text: Left: Impact of the three kinds of false positives on mean AP
ization, B : detection on background, and S : misﬁrings on similar categories. Right:
Disambiguating between two kinds of mislocalizations. Bars to the left mean that we
frequently overshoot the ground truth, while bars to the right mean that we undershoot.
(assuming perfect localization) and loss in AP
due to mislocalization for all systems.
performance on the individual tasks. To compare on AP
region classiﬁers for the bounding box detection task. This is because the rank-
ing of regions based on bounding box overlap is diﬀerent from that based on
segmentation overlap. As in [16], we use ground truth boxes as positive, and
MCG boxes overlapping by less than 50% as negative. At test time we do not
We add two baselines: R-CNN is the system of Girshick
and R-CNN-MCG is R-CNN on boxes from MCG instead of Selective Search.
Note that neither of these baselines uses features from the region foreground.
, with improvements on the latter metric being somewhat
larger. The right half of Figure 5 shows the variation in AP
overlap threshold for counting something as correct. We plot the improvement
over vanilla R-CNN. We do worse than R-CNN for low thresholds, but
are much better for higher thresholds. This is also true to some extent for R-
CNN-MCG, so this is partly a property of MCG, and partly a consequence of
posit that this is because now the entire network has been ﬁnetuned for SDS.
on PASCAL VOC 2012 test. Our mean AP
an improvement over the R-CNN mean AP
regression), and much better than other systems, such as SegDPM [14] (
